intro: Amylotheca insularum, commonly known as the island star moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant characterized by its small, flattened thallus that grows in dense mats on rocky or sandy soils. The plant is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained, sunny conditions. Its structure consists of a leafy stem with closely packed, scale-like leaves that are often green or reddish in color. Amylotheca insularum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing microhabitats for other organisms in its native ecosystems.
